intro: Tinus henryi, commonly known as the Henry's tinus, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This succulent plant is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky outcrops. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
